name: ChemistrySpatial
description: Lists all particles in the simulation cell with composition, position, size, shape and type of each particle.

dimensions.name: ncoords
dimensions.description: Number of coordinates or spatial dimensions. 2D/3D

properties.name: simulation_box
properties.description: Size of the simulation box, i.e. the length of the vectors defining the simulation box assuming right angles between them.

properties.name: elements
properties.description: Chemical symbol of each chemical element.  By convension the dependent element (e.g. Al) is listed first.

properties.name: X0
properties.description: Nominal composition.  Should sum to one.

properties.name: Xp
properties.description: Average composition of each particle.  Each row should sum to one.

properties.name: positions
properties.description: Position of center of mass of each particle.  QUESTION: should the positions be expressed in terms of the simulation_box (such that coordinates within the box are between 0 and 1)?

properties.name: rd
properties.description: Equivalent spherical radius (radius of a sphere with the same volume as the particle) for each domain.

properties.name: shape
properties.description: Shape parameter for each domain.  It is defined as ``6*sqrt(pi)*V/S^(3/2)``, where V and S are the particle volume and surface area, respectively.  The shape parameter will always be equal to or less than one, where one corresponds to spherical particles.

properties.name: angles
properties.description: Angle of the long radius. 2D: angle between the long radius and x-axis. 3D: spherical angles (theta, phi) of the long axis.

properties.name: phasename
properties.description: Name of the phase of each particle.

properties.name: atvol
properties.description: Average volume per atom for each phase.
